etymologies: early 19th century: of unknown origin; compare with earlier nabs, used similarly with a possessive adjective as in his nabs, on the pattern of references to the aristocracy such as his lordship

definitions: a mock title used to refer to a self-important man, especially one in authority

examples.text: his nibs expects things to be organized to suit him

shortDefinitions: mock title used to refer to self-important man
